title: Ticket #4462: Parent-child security sessions never expire
description: When a daemon spawns a child daemon, it creates a security session for the two to use. This security session has an infinite lifetime and isn't explicitly removed when the child exits. It also punches a hole in the authorization table for the child's identity, but never fills it back in. This is particularly troublesome for the schedd and startd, which spawn a new child process for each running job.
remarks:
2014-Jul-30 10:07:26 by jfrey:
The security session for the child is removed by the parent when it reaps the child. Nothing to see here. Move along.
